attributes.action: Force the Royal Mail to release their Postcode Geodata for free.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Every major country's postal code geocode data is available for free which allows other countries to have much more interactive websites showing nearest doctors to user etc. In the UK the Royal Mail has copyright of this data and charges huge amounts for access to this data (around £2500 initially and then around £1500 per year after that!) This makes sure that only large companies can afford to access this data and prevents small start-up sites and more importantly free services from making use of this data. It is ridiculous that I can produce a site that uses the US, French, German data etc but I can't use UK data!
